title: (x) Campagnolo, name of font or suggestion of something similar? - various alternatives {gang}
content:
Hi!  
I´m looking for a font similar to the font used in the Campagnolo-logo.  
Anyone know the name of the font they use? Or do you have a suggestion for something similar?  
I kind of like [www.dafont.com/ballpark-weiner.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20150325212535/http:/www.dafont.com/ballpark-weiner.font "www.dafont.com/ballpark-weiner.font")  
But I need something that feels more "strict" and have more of a feeling of speed.  
Any suggestions?  
thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [campa\_logo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150325212535/http:/typophile.com/files/campa_logo.jpg) | 96.5 KB |
author: gabbbahey

comments.content:
This is most certainly a custom design.  
How about [Home Run](http://web.archive.org/web/20150325212535/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/doyald-young/home-run/) by Doyald Young as an alternative?

Tom Kennedy has two similar scripts at Letterhead Fonts: [Ephemera](http://web.archive.org/web/20150325212535/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/ephemera.shtml) and [Ballpark Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150325212535/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/ballparkscript.php). I think the lower case of Ephemera is most like your sample.

- Mike Yanega

Thanks for your help!  
I´ll probably go for Home Run.

You might check [Philly Sport](http://web.archive.org/web/20150325212535/http:/www.fontmarketplace.com/font/philly-sport.aspx), similar to Ballpark Weiner. But I'd really like to find the Campagnolo font, too.
